stem: A 34-year-old client with a T4 spinal cord injury (SCI) reports a severe headache and flushing above the chest. Based on the provided information, identify the most likely condition, two appropriate nursing actions, and two essential parameters to monitor.

tabs.title: SBAR
tabs.content:
Situation: Acute hypertensive emergency in a client with a history of SCI.
Background: T4 level injury (5 years ago). Indwelling Foley catheter in place.
Assessment: BP 198/112 mmHg. Profuse sweating and goosebumps on legs noted.
Recommendation: Identify the trigger and elevate the head of the bed.

tabs.title: Trigger Assessment Log
tabs.content:
SourceAssessmentResult
BladderFoley Catheter tubingKinked under the client's thigh
BowelPalpation of lower quadrantDistended (Last BM 3 days ago)
SkinToes / SheetsIngrown toenail with redness
Urine BagVolumeEmpty for 3 hours

tabs.title: Vital Signs
tabs.content: BP 198/112 mmHg, HR 48 bpm, RR 22 breaths/min, T 98.4Â°F. Flushed above T4; Pale below T4.

actionOptions.text: Elevate the head of the bed to 90 degrees
Identify and remove the triggering stimulus
Place the client in Trendelenburg position

parameterOptions.text: Continuous blood pressure and heart rate
Urinary drainage system patency and bowel status

rationale.correct: The client is experiencing Autonomic Dysreflexia (AD) (c1), a complication of SCI at T6 or above. The kinked Foley (trigger) causes a sympathetic surge, leading to vasoconstriction and severe hypertension. The body compensates with bradycardia. Elevating the HOB (a1) uses gravity to lower BP. Identifying and removing the trigger (a2) is crucial. Monitoring BP (p1) and trigger status (p2) is essential.
clinicalPearls: Noxious stimuli below the injury level (full bladder/bowel, tight shoe, ingrown nail) can trigger AD.
Flushing above and pallor below the injury level occur because the brain vasodilates above the injury to lower pressure.
If BP remains high after trigger removal, hydralazine or nitrates may be needed.

questionTrap.trap: Calling a Rapid Response before elevating the HOB.
questionTrap.howToOvercome: Elevate the HOB FIRST to lower BP while waiting for help.

mnemonic.title: B-B-B-B (AD Triggers)
mnemonic.expansion: B-Bladder (Full/Kinked). B-Bowel (Impacted). B-Back (Pressure sores). B-Binding (Tight clothes).
